name: Best-first feature selection with cross-validation
description:
Script to select the `n` best features for modeling a given dataset,
using a greedy algorithm. It only works for classification problems,
i.e., this script needs a categorical objective field.

**How the greedy algorithm works:**

The algorithm initializes the set of `S` features taking into
account the pre-selected best features from the dataset-id selected as
**input. If there are not pre-selected features, `S` will be empty.**

For each iteration: 

  - For each feature `f` in the dataset-id selected as input that is not
in `S`, it trains a model with feature set `S + f`. By default, the
algorithm builds decision trees, however you can select another
algorithms and its parametrization by configuring the options. For
example, if you set `{number_of_models: 40}` ensembles with 40 models
will be trained at each iteration.

  - Then each model built with the feature set `S + f` is evaluated
using k-fold cross-validation. 

  - The algorithm greedily selects the feature `f` with the best
performance using the metric `average_phi` minus the standard deviation
(derived from the cross-validation) to use the worst case as metric of
performance.

  - If the feature `f` improves the performance of the last
iteration, i.e. if the improvement is higher than the % set as the
early-stop-performance, it is added it to `S`.

  - If the feature `f` have not improved the performance of the model,
i.e. the improvement is lower than the percentage set as
`early-stop-performance`, after a certain number of iterations (set by
`max-low-perf-iterations`) , the execution will stop. 

Find more info in [readme](https://github.com/whizzml/examples/blob/master/best-first-cv/readme.md)

inputs.name: dataset-id
inputs.description: The data to select features from

inputs.name: max-n
inputs.description: The number of maximum features (that is, dataset fields)  to return, including pre-selected features.

inputs.name: objective-id
inputs.description: Objective field ID, or empty for default dataset objective field

inputs.name: options
inputs.description: Configuration options to select the algorithm and its parametrization, e.g. 'number_of_models':40 will train ensembles. If empty, models will be train

inputs.name: k-folds
inputs.description: Number of k-folds in the cross-validation

inputs.name: pre-selected-fields
inputs.description: List of field IDs to be pre-selected as best features. The script won't consider them but they will be included in the output

inputs.name: early-stop-performance
inputs.description: Performance improvement threshold (in %) above which a feature is selected unconditionally

inputs.name: max-low-perf-iterations
inputs.description: Maximum number of iterations with low performance, as percentage of the number of initial features

outputs.name: output-features
outputs.description: The list of the selected features and some info from the performance of each iteration

outputs.name: output-dataset
outputs.description: A new dataset containing only the selected features
